Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink, smudged in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.202)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36485) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36485)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 349 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
